intro: Cicerbita prenanthoides, commonly known as the yellow toadflax, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its yellow or orange bell-shaped flowers. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Cicerbita prenanthoides is adapted to arid environments and is considered a valuable plant for stabilizing soil in disturbed areas.
